decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | Detailed drawings and samples of materials in respect of the following, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority in writing prior to commencement of the work:  + Samples of the proposed stone flooring to internal and external areas, and external decking. + Details of the cladding to the cupboards in the dining area and the design of the new doors and cupboards in the corridor at ground floor level. + A panel sample and a method statement for the cleaning and refinishing of the ground floor panelling and bookcases. + Details of the works to protect/screen the tiles and other original features (toilet roll holder, soap dish and wall cabinet) in the 'green' bathroom. + Details of the design and materials of the free-standing screen to the sofa bed position.  + Design and material details for the fire bowl and cladding to fire place. . Details of the design, materials, finished and construction (at an appropriate scale) of the new windows, doors, roof/canopy, support to new ground floor rear addition and the rooflight and vertical glazed slots between the new and existing structure. . Details of the design, materials, finish and construction (at an appropriate scale) of the new internal staircase and handrail. . Samples of the external render colour.    Such details shall be implemented only in accordance with the drawings as approved.  REASON: To safeguard the special architectural or historic interest of the building. In accordance with policies 4.1, 4.6, 4.8, 5.5 and 5.9 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' 2004. | Prior to any work being commenced, colour photographs shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority of the living room, dining room, green bathroom, white bathroom, kitchen, rear and east elevation.  REASON:	In order to safeguard the special architectural or historic interest of the building. In accordance with policies 4.1, 4.6, 4.8, 5.5 and 5.9 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' 2004. | Any damage to the building caused by or during the course of  the carrying out of the works permitted shall be made good within 3 months of the completion of the development in accordance with a specification agreed in writing with the local planning authority.  REASON: To safeguard the architectural and/or historic interest of the building. In accordance with policies 4.1, 4.6, 4.8, 5.5 and 5.9 of Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' 2004.
description: Internal and external alterations including excavation to provide extension to basement with lightwells, single storey rear extension and canopy, rear patio area, timber decking to front roof terrace at first floor level, provision of internal staircase to basement, removal of part rear main wall at ground floor level, all with ancillary works. (Listed Building Consent)
